Author: Allison
Description:
We’ve updated the /dashboard-feed page on GitHub.com to align with improvements to the homepage “For you” feed, bringing a more consistent and performant experience across GitHub. What’s new Faster, more…

The post [The dashboard-feed page gets a refreshed, faster experience](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-09-04-the-dashboard-feed-page-gets-a-refreshed-faster-experience) appeared first on [The GitHub Blog](https://github.blog).
EnhancedContent:
We’ve updated the /dashboard-feed page on GitHub.com to align with improvements to the homepage “For you” feed, bringing a more consistent and performant experience across GitHub.

### What’s new

- **Faster, more up-to-date events**: The dashboard feed page now uses our newer feeds infrastructure, improving freshness and reliability.
- **A refreshed look and feel**: Events display in the same modern, readable card layout as the “For you” feed.
- **More event types**: You’ll see expanded event coverage including announcements, releases, and sponsors activity.
- **Gentle recommendations you can tune**: When recommendations appear, select **See less activity like this** to help refine what you see.

### What remains the same

- **No filters**: The dashboard feed page doesn’t include the filtering controls available in the “For you” feed.
- **Chronological ordering**: Events appear newest to oldest, consistent with the February 14, 2025 [“For you” feed update](https://github.blog/changelog/2025-02-14-reverting-feed-activity-sorting-back-to-chronological-ordering).
- **Same location**: Access your dashboard feed page at [github.com/dashboard-feed](https://github.com/dashboard-feed).

### Why this changed

Moving to our latest infrastructure improves event freshness and creates a more consistent GitHub experience. This update also paves the way for continued performance improvements.

### Availability

This change is gradually rolling out following publication of this post.

### Share your feedback

Tell us what you think and how we can improve the dashboard feed page by [opening a discussion](https://github.com/orgs/community/discussions) in the GitHub Community.
Title: The dashboard-feed page gets a refreshed, faster experience
